creator: rvg16@axelero.hu
text:
I saw a big-big probleme!

I use Internet Explorer, and when I open the Apache root, the code of the page 
is UTF-8, but in the httpd.conf the default code is ISO-8859-1...

Please fix this bug, because I can't use apache 2.0 with this bug, but I want 
it...

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
In fact, the default page is in US-ASCII, a subset of ISO-8859-1, regardless
of what windows thinks.  But in any case, I can't imagine why this would stop
you from using Apache.

It sounds to me like you need some help which would be better provided in the
users mailing list, rather than the bug database.
http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html
